gov.sandia.cognition.graph

Class DenseMemoryGraph<NodeNameType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.sandia.cognition.graph.DenseMemoryGraph<NodeNameType>
  • Type Parameters:
    NodeNameType - The type for the node names
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WeightedDenseMemoryGraph

    public class DenseMemoryGraph<NodeNameType>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>, java.io.Serializable
    Most basic-est of graph types. This is a directed graph that stores node names and edges between them
    Author:
    jdwendt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DenseMemoryGraph

        public DenseMemoryGraph()
        Initializes an empty graph. Execution: O(1).

      • DenseMemoryGraph

        public DenseMemoryGraph(int expectedNumNodes,
                        int expectedNumEdges)
        Initializes an empty graph, but sets aside O(m + n) memory. This speeds up later filling of the graph by removing the need to re-allocate more memory for the nodes and edges as the graph grows (until the input values are exceeded at least). Execution: O(1) + time to allocate O(m+n) memory.
        Parameters:
        expectedNumNodes - The expected number of nodes for the graph
        expectedNumEdges - The expected number of edges for the graph

      • addNode

        public void addNode(NodeNameType node)
        Description copied from interface: DirectedNodeEdgeGraph
        Adds the input node to the graph. Calling this method is unnecessary if the node participates in any edges. If you call DirectedNodeEdgeGraph.addEdge(Object, Object), it handles adding new nodes.
        Specified by:
        addNode in interface DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add to the graph

      • getSuccessors

        public java.util.Collection<NodeNameType> getSuccessors(NodeNameType node)
        Description copied from interface: DirectedNodeEdgeGraph
        Returns all the nodes this node connects to (outgoing edges only).
        Specified by:
        getSuccessors in interface DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose successors are requested
        Returns:
        all the nodes this node connects to.
        See Also:
        Execution: O(log m + d) where d is the degree of the input node (d can be O(m) but usually is closer to O(1)) (With a O(m log m) one-time cost after edges are newly added)

      • getEdgeEndpointIds

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> getEdgeEndpointIds(int i)
        Helper that returns the endpoint values for the input edge id. Execution: O(1) (one time O(m log m) cost after addEdges is called to get the edges in the right order)
        Specified by:
        getEdgeEndpointIds in interface DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
        Parameters:
        i - The edge id to search for
        Returns:
        the endpoint values for the input edge id

      • getFirstEdgeFrom

        protected int getFirstEdgeFrom(int nodeVal)
        Helper that returns the first edge that node nodeVal (id) participates in. Execution: O(log m + d) where d is the degree of node nodeVal (With a O(m log m) one-time cost after edges are newly added)
        Parameters:
        nodeVal - The id of the node whose first edge is sought
        Returns:
        The integer id of the first edge nodeVal participates in

      • optimizeEdges

        protected void optimizeEdges()
        This private helper sorts all edges for quicker edge-lookup times. Execution: If !isOptimized, O(m log m), else O(1).

      • swap

        protected void swap(int i,
                    int j)
        Helper that swaps the values at i and j in the edge list (handles the fact that the edge list is 2 values in a row for each edge). Execution: O(1)
        Parameters:
        i - The edge index to swap with j
        j - The edge index to swap with i
